title: Dairy Farm Routines
text: Fixing the irrigation. We record yields and monitor feed intake. We rotate pastures to improve forage quality. I use simple tools for daily tasks. I adjust irrigation when the soil is dry. We follow safety steps in the barn. Sprayer calibration prevents over application. This is my routine at the dairy farm. The tractor needs a safety check before operation. Farm safety rules are part of our routine. In winter we protect equipment from freezing. The greenhouse helps control temperature and humidity. We start work before sunrise during harvest. Irrigation is scheduled to reduce water waste. Veterinary biosecurity keeps the herd healthy.
